TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 721
TEI.2.document_title: Philip T. Dimmitt to Stephen F. Austin, 01-04-1824

barker_notes.barker_summary: Power of attorney to reclaim stolen horses and mules.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 721

div1.p: Power of attorney to reclaim stolen horses and mules.

this 4 Day of January 1824 I doo empower Stept F Austin to take in possession 11 mules with those marks [mark inserted] 10 mules marked thus [mark inserted] one Horse mule marked thus [mark inserted] and five Head of Horses marked As the Ten mules the eleven mules being stold or straid and five head of Horses this Given under my Hand, as a Power, attorney to empower Mr Austin to take or sease any mules or Horses with the above marks witness my [hand] this 4th day January 1824
